summary: This is a formal request for mutual legal assistance from the Paris Public Prosecutor's Office to U.S. authorities, dated July 8, 2020. It outlines the French investigation into Jean-Luc Brunel and others in connection with the Epstein case, detailing allegations of sexual assault, rape, and participation in a criminal association. The request seeks U.S. investigative materials related to Brunel, Ghislaine Maxwell, and French victims.

persons.name: Jean-Luc Brunel
persons.role: Director of modeling agencies (Karin Models, MC2), accused
persons.context: French modeling agency director and close friend of Jeffrey Epstein, accused of sexually assaulting and raping multiple young women, including providing girls from his agency to Epstein. Subject of the French investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Accused, central figure in the network
persons.context: American financier accused of sexually exploiting dozens of young girls and setting up a network. The French investigation is connected to his case. He was arrested in 2019 and later died in jail.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Described as Epstein's partner, accused of organizing the travel and stays of victims at Epstein's residences and recruiting a victim for sexual exploitation. Arrested in the U.S. on July 2, 2020.

persons.name: Gerald Marie
persons.role: Associate at Paris Planning modeling agency
persons.context: Mentioned in the testimony of a victim who was with him and Jean-Luc Brunel at an apartment before an incident in the countryside where Brunel attempted to rape her.

persons.name: Prince Albert de Monaco
persons.context: A man posing as Prince Albert de Monaco was reported to have called Jean-Luc Brunel while a victim was in Brunel's apartment.

persons.name: Arindam Bhattacharya
persons.context: The sworn translator registered with the Appeal Court of Paris who certified the English translation of the document.

connections.description: Described as close friends; Brunel allegedly provided young girls from his modeling agency pool to Epstein.
Described as Epstein's partner; she allegedly organized the travel and stays of victims for him.
Both are named as part of the network benefiting from and facilitating Epstein's activities.
Both were present with a victim at an apartment; Marie worked at the Paris Planning modeling agency.

events.title: French Preliminary Investigation Opened
events.description: The Paris Public Prosecutor's Office initiated a preliminary investigation into charges including rape of minors, sexual assault, and participation in a criminal association related to Jeffrey Epstein and his accomplices, concerning French victims.

events.title: Initial Report from 'Innocence en danger'
events.description: The Public Prosecutor's Office received a report from the association 'Innocence en danger' stating France was concerned due to French nationals being involved and that French victims existed in Epstein's network.

events.title: Search of Epstein's Paris Residence
events.description: French authorities searched Jeffrey Epstein's Paris apartment at 22 Avenue Foch, seizing computers, storage media, documents related to Ghislaine Maxwell, and photographs of young women.

events.title: Arrest and Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested, charged, and detained in Manhattan in the summer of 2019 after returning from Paris. He was later found dead in his cell.

events.title: Arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested on American soil.

locations: 22 Avenue Foch, Paris 16th district (Epstein's Paris residence)
Avenue Hoche, Paris (Jean-Luc Brunel's Parisian home)
Avenue Foch, Paris (mentioned in victim testimony)
keyFacts: The French investigation, opened on August 30, 2019, focuses on Jean-Luc Brunel and others for crimes including rape of minors and participation in a criminal association linked to Jeffrey Epstein.
French authorities seized evidence from Epstein's Paris apartment including computers containing numerous photos and videos of young girls, and an Excel file with a list of 62 women's names.
Victim testimonies collected by French investigators describe sexual assaults and rapes by Jean-Luc Brunel, often involving modeling agencies, drugs, and loss of consciousness.
The document is a formal request for all U.S. investigative materials concerning Brunel, Maxwell, and French victims, highlighting international cooperation.
The request emphasizes confidentiality and reciprocity under the 2003 EU-U.S. mutual legal assistance agreement.
